net.sf.opensftp
Class AbstractProgressListener

java.lang.Object
  net.sf.opensftp.AbstractProgressListener
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable, ProgressListener
Direct Known Subclasses:
BaseProgressListener
public abstract class AbstractProgressListener
extends java.lang.Object
implements ProgressListener

An easy approach to work with ProgressListener. It's more advisable to extend this class than to implement ProgressListener directly.

Since:
0.2
Author:
BurningXFlame@gmail.com

Idle means ready for use.
NOTE: Before using a ProgressListener, call setIdle(false) first. The method ProgressListener.complete() should call setIdle(true) at its very end. setIdle(true) should be called when the transfer which this ProgressListener is monitoring has been cancelled (not going to be cancelled).

Method Detail

init

public abstract void init(int op,
                          java.lang.String src,
                          java.lang.String dest,
                          long total)
Description copied from interface: ProgressListener
A callback method which will be called when a new transfer is about to be initiated.

Specified by:
init in interface ProgressListener
Parameters:
op - the operation type. Valid values are ProgressListener.PUT and ProgressListener.GET.
src - the path of the source file
dest - the destination path
total - the size of the file measured with a certain unit.

progress

public abstract void progress(long delta)
Description copied from interface: ProgressListener
A callback method which will be called when more data has been transferred.

Specified by:
progress in interface ProgressListener
Parameters:
delta - an increment, i.e. the newly transferred size, measured with the same unit with the total param of ProgressListener.init(int, String, String, long).

complete

public abstract void complete()
Description copied from interface: ProgressListener
A callback method which will be called when the transfer is completed.

Specified by:
complete in interface ProgressListener

cancel

public void cancel()
Description copied from interface: ProgressListener
Call this method to cancel the transfer which this ProgressListener is monitoring.
This method, together with ProgressListener.isCancelled(), enables you to cancel a transfer. To accomplish this function, the concrete implementation of SftpUtil should repeatedly call ProgressListener.isCancelled() during a transfer by a certain frequency to determine whether to continue the transfer or not.
NOTE: please make ProgressListener.cancel() and ProgressListener.isCancelled() be a pair of synchronized methods.

Specified by:
cancel in interface ProgressListener

isCancelled

public boolean isCancelled()
Description copied from interface: ProgressListener
Checks whether the transfer has been cancelled.
Please refer to method ProgressListener.cancel() for more details.

Specified by:
isCancelled in interface ProgressListener
Returns:
true if the transfer has been cancelled; false otherwise.

setIdle

public void setIdle(boolean idle)
Description copied from interface: ProgressListener
Sets the status of this ProgressListener, idle or not.
Idle means ready for use.
NOTE:
  • Before using a ProgressListener, call setIdle(false) first.
  • The method ProgressListener.complete() should call setIdle(true) at its very end.
  • setIdle(true) should be called when the transfer which this ProgressListener is monitoring has been cancelled (not going to be cancelled).

Specified by:
setIdle in interface ProgressListener

isIdle

public boolean isIdle()
Description copied from interface: ProgressListener
Checks whether this ProgressListener is idle or not.
Idle means ready for use.

Specified by:
isIdle in interface ProgressListener
Returns:
true if this ProgressListener is idle; false otherwise.

reset

public void reset()
Description copied from interface: ProgressListener
Resets this ProgressListener.
This method should reset the operation type, the source path, the destination path, the total size of the file and the current progress.
Before resetting and reusing a ProgressListener, please make sure the transfer which this ProgressListener is monitoring has been completed or cancelled.

Specified by:
reset in interface ProgressListener

clone

public abstract ProgressListener clone()
Description copied from interface: ProgressListener
Creates and returns a clean copy of this ProgressListener.
NOTE: Don't clone the operation type, the source path, the destination path, the total size of the file and the current progress. Conversely, reset them.

Specified by:
clone in interface ProgressListener
Overrides:
clone in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
a clean copy of this ProgressListener

newInstance

public ProgressListener newInstance()
Description copied from interface: ProgressListener
Returns an instance of ProgressListener.
The algorithm is as follows:
  • Returns this object itself if it's idle. Reset it before return.
  • Returns a clean copy of this object.
To make this method work, make sure to implement the following methods correctly:
ProgressListener.isIdle(), ProgressListener.setIdle(boolean), ProgressListener.reset(), ProgressListener.clone().
And make sure ProgressListener.setIdle(boolean) is called in any scenario where it should be.

Specified by:
newInstance in interface ProgressListener
Returns:
a clean instance
See Also:
ProgressListener.isIdle(), ProgressListener.setIdle(boolean), ProgressListener.reset(), ProgressListener.clone()
